channel.title: The Sweethome
channel.description: A list of the best home goods and gear

item.title: Early reviews of new robot vacuums from Neato and Moneual are in
item.dc:creator: Erica Ogg
item.description: The first reviews of the Neato BotVac 85 and Moneual Rydis H68 are in. See our robot vacuum guide for the results.
item.content:encoded: The first reviews of the Neato BotVac 85 and Moneual Rydis H68 are in. See our robot vacuum guide for the results.

item.title: Updated: Best LED light bulb
item.dc:creator: Erica Ogg
item.description: We updated our LED bulb guide with news of the Philips SlimStyle’s Energy Star certification and the results of a color accuracy test of Cree’s TW Series bulb.
item.content:encoded: We updated our LED bulb guide with news of the Philips SlimStyle’s Energy Star certification and the results of a color accuracy test of Cree’s TW Series bulb.

item.title: The Best Fan
item.dc:creator: Erica Ogg
item.description: As the weather warms up, we recommend the Vornado 660 fan to keep you cool. It’s powerful yet quiet and has a design and footprint that makes it suitable for use on a floor or a desk.
item.content:encoded: As the weather warms up, we recommend the Vornado 660 fan to keep you cool. It’s powerful yet quiet and has a design and footprint that makes it suitable for use on a floor or a desk.

item.title: The Best Soft-Structured Baby Carrier
item.dc:creator: The NightLight
item.description: After four months of researching babywearing options and demoing more than a dozen different soft-structured options, we found the best of the bunch to be the BabyBjörn Baby Carrier One ($150) because it’s comfortable (for baby and you) and supportive for infants as well as toddlers. Plus, it’s pretty simple to use and adjust for […]
item.content:encoded: After four months of researching babywearing options and demoing more than a dozen different soft-structured options, we found the best of the bunch to be the BabyBjörn Baby Carrier One ($150) because it’s comfortable (for baby and you) and supportive for infants as well as toddlers. Plus, it’s pretty simple to use and adjust for different-sized babies and adults. Ultimately, that’s what pushed it to the very top of our list, over top contenders like the Beco Gemini and Cybex 2.Go.

item.title: Deals: Our second favorite electric kettle, the Bonavita Gooseneck, is at its lowest price, $60 (from $85)
item.dc:creator: J.D. Levite
item.description: Best Deals: Our second favorite electric kettle, the Bonavita 1-Liter Gooseneck, is still at a good low price, $61 (from $85). [Casa]
item.content:encoded: Best Deals: Our second favorite electric kettle, the Bonavita 1-Liter Gooseneck, is still at a good low price, $61 (from $85). [Casa]

item.title: The Best Umbrella
item.dc:creator: Andrew Kalinchuk
item.description: At the Wirecutter, we found the best umbrella by simulating rain in a two-headed shower and gusts of wind with a leaf blower. The EuroSCHIRM Light Trek will keep you visibly drier than the competition and is built to survive the elements. It was also the widest and deepest umbrella when open but among the smallest closed.
item.content:encoded: At the Wirecutter, we found the best umbrella by simulating rain in a two-headed shower and gusts of wind with a leaf blower. The EuroSCHIRM Light Trek will keep you visibly drier than the competition and is built to survive the elements. It was also the widest and deepest umbrella when open but among the smallest closed.

item.title: Why we like the Trek 7.2 FX bike over the 7.1
item.dc:creator: Erica Ogg
item.description: We added a detailed explanation to the hybrid bike guide of why we prefer the Trek 7.2 FX over the 7.1 model.
item.content:encoded: We added a detailed explanation to the hybrid bike guide of why we prefer the Trek 7.2 FX over the 7.1 model.

item.title: The Best Blender
item.dc:creator: Christine Cyr Clisset
item.description: If you’re looking for a blender that will weather years of wear and tear and can finely process nearly any ingredient you throw into it, you want the Vitamix 5200. At around $450, it’s an investment, but our testing shows that it blows the competition out of the water. We built on the research in […]
item.content:encoded: If you’re looking for a blender that will weather years of wear and tear and can finely process nearly any ingredient you throw into it, you want the Vitamix 5200. At around $450, it’s an investment, but our testing shows that it blows the competition out of the water. We built on the research in our previous blender guide, adding 14 hours of research, 12 hours of testing nine blenders, interviews with experts, and hundreds of user reviews. The Vitamix 5200 was the only model we tested that could handle everything from emulsifying mayonnaise to processing silky-smooth purées and nut butters. As Vitamix’s most basic and popular model, it  has a great long-term track record and also happens to be the least expensive model the company makes.

item.title: The best alternative to our electric toothbrush pick
item.dc:creator: Erica Ogg
item.description: Our favorite electric toothbrush is currently out of stock on Amazon so we highlighted the best alternative in case you need a new one now.
item.content:encoded: Our favorite electric toothbrush is currently out of stock on Amazon so we highlighted the best alternative in case you need a new one now.

item.title: The Best Soda Maker
item.dc:creator: Jamie Wiebe
item.description: If you drink a lot of seltzer and are tired of wasting plastic bottle after plastic bottle from the grocery store, you should get the Mastrad Purefizz. It’s simple to use, easy to clean, and made the best-tasting fizzy water we tested, almost beating our store-bought control.
item.content:encoded: If you drink a lot of seltzer and are tired of wasting plastic bottle after plastic bottle from the grocery store, you should get the Mastrad Purefizz. It’s simple to use, easy to clean, and made the best-tasting fizzy water we tested, almost beating our store-bought control.
